content.title: SAHAKAR MITRA: NCDC’s Scheme on Internship Programme
content.department: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
content.details: The 'SAHAKAR MITRA Scheme on Internship Programme (SIP)' was introduced by the National Cooperative Development Corporation (NCDC) in the year 2012-13 with an objective to provide work-related learning experience in the core and special fields of functioning of NCDC to students of professional courses and to project contribution and achievements of NCDC in the development of cooperatives. The scheme was expanded to cover different states by offering SIP to students (in 2nd year of MBA Agri-Business) from State Agricultural Universities in the states where NCDC’s Regional Offices are located. Interns have gained valuable knowledge and experience in the cooperative sector over the years. Under the programme, NCDC will provide short-term (not exceeding four months) opportunities to young professionals to acquire learning experience by applying skills and knowledge in an organizational context to facilitate professional development.
benefits: Consolidated monthly amount of ₹10,000/- for 4 months towards partly meeting out-of-pocket expenses (Total: ₹40,000/-)
Expenses related to report preparation (lumpsum amount towards data collection, analysis, and preparation of a report) (Total: ₹5,000/-)
Total financial support provided by NCDC during the SIP is ₹45,000/-
eligibility: Professional graduates with minimum qualification as Bachelor’s degree in Agri/ Dairy/ Animal Husbandry/ Veterinary Sciences/ Fisheries/Horticulture/ Textiles/ Handloom / IT duly recommended by the Head of the Department of the UGC / AICTE / ICAR recognized Universities / Institutions as applicable.

Professionals (pursuing or completed) MBA Agri Business / MBA Coop / M.Com / MCA / MBA Finance / MBA International Trade/MBA Forestry/MBA Rural Dev / MBA Project Management / Inter ICAI / Inter ICWA qualification duly recommended by the Head of the Department of the UGC / AICTE / ICAR recognized Universities / Institutions as applicable.
A person cannot be taken as an intern more than once.
content.application_process: Online application process through the official Portal NCDC: Sahakar Mitra. Steps include registration, verification, and submission of the application form.

faqs.question: What is 'SAHAKAR MITRA Scheme on Internship Programme (SIP)'?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, NCDC will provide short-term (not exceeding four months) opportunities to young professionals to acquire learning experience by applying skills and knowledge in an organizational context to facilitate professional development.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the SIP?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to provide work-related learning experience in the core and special fields of functioning of NCDC to students of professional courses and to project contribution and achievements of NCDC in the development of cooperatives.

faqs.question: What is the aim of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The Scheme aims at providing an opportunity for professional graduates to get experience in areas of functioning of NCDC and related aspects of cooperatives.

faqs.question: When was the SIP introduced, and why?
faqs.answer: The SIP was introduced in the year 2012-13 to facilitate work-related learning experiences for students and contribute to the development of cooperatives.

faqs.question: What is the maximum duration of the internship period at NCDC?
faqs.answer: The internship period at NCDC shall not exceed four months for a person.

faqs.question: Is the financial support meant to cover only out-of-pocket expenses?
faqs.answer: Yes, the consolidated monthly amount of ₹10,000/- is intended to partly cover the interns' out-of-pocket expenses during the four-month SIP.

faqs.question: What is the total financial support offered by NCDC during the SIP?
faqs.answer: The total financial support provided by NCDC to interns during the SIP is ₹45,000/-, inclusive of the consolidated monthly amount and expenses related to report preparation.

faqs.question: Where will the interns be placed?
faqs.answer: Interns will be placed at the Head Office (HO), LINAC, or Regional Offices (ROs) based on their preferences and the requirements of NCDC.

faqs.question: Can a person participate in the internship program more than once?
faqs.answer: No, a person cannot be taken as an intern more than once as per the program guidelines.

faqs.question: How can I apply for Sahakar Mitra?
faqs.answer: Visit the official Portal NCDC: Sahakar Mitra.
